response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age", "medium", "At 21, the individual is young, which can correlate with a higher risk of reoffending, although it is balanced by other factors."],
    ["Criminal History", "high", "Having been arrested 7 times with prior convictions indicates a strong pattern of offending, substantially increasing the risk."],
    ["Substance Use", "medium", "Recent use of marijuana in the past four years presents moderate risk, given its association with behavioral disinhibition."],
    ["Employment Stability", "medium", "Holding 2 jobs in the past year suggests some level of occupational turnover, which can be a risk factor though not the highest."],
    ["Social Support", "medium", "Living alone and never having been married might indicate limited social support, contributing moderately to risk."],
    ["Education", "low", "Having a high school diploma provides a basic level of education, which is a protective factor relative to lower educational attainment."],
    ["Family Background", "medium", "Growing up in an urban household of size 5 may involve exposure to environmental stressors, leading to moderate risk."],
    ["Mental Health", "low", "Not feeling depressed over the past month reduces the likelihood of mental health issues contributing to reoffending."],
    ["Religious Beliefs", "low", "Believing that God has a role in personal events can be a protective factor, providing personal resilience."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 80
}

risk_factors: At 21, the individual is young, which can correlate with a higher risk of reoffending, although it is balanced by other factors.
Having been arrested 7 times with prior convictions indicates a strong pattern of offending, substantially increasing the risk.
Recent use of marijuana in the past four years presents moderate risk, given its association with behavioral disinhibition.
Holding 2 jobs in the past year suggests some level of occupational turnover, which can be a risk factor though not the highest.
Living alone and never having been married might indicate limited social support, contributing moderately to risk.
Having a high school diploma provides a basic level of education, which is a protective factor relative to lower educational attainment.
Growing up in an urban household of size 5 may involve exposure to environmental stressors, leading to moderate risk.
Not feeling depressed over the past month reduces the likelihood of mental health issues contributing to reoffending.
Believing that God has a role in personal events can be a protective factor, providing personal resilience.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 7 times and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 7 inches and weighs 142 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 2 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 5, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
